title: Enrollment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: I completed the interview process in less than 2 weeks. I spoke with the immediate supervisor only and submitted references. I started work in the same month. Onboarding took about a month.
Interview Questions: DEI, relationship with colleagues, how you communicate with students

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: I had 1 phone interview, and 1 panel interview. The questions were job related and personality related. It was a very friendly atmosphere, and felt very comfortable. I was offered the job just a few days after.
Interview Questions: Do you work well with a family-oriented atmosphere?

title: Asst. Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: It was spread over two days and involved various meetings and a presentation of my work. This is in line with what schools usually do when they interview for faculty positions in my field.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this school?

title: ITSM Administrator Level III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sam Houston State in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Two Virtual interviews - The first one - with one person. The second interview was a panel interview with 5 people. Rapid round interview on behavior questions. No technical questions were asked. It seemed like they already had a candidate in mind and this was a formality.
Interview Questions: Behavior questions - What is the most important thing that you value in a team?

title: Scheduling Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview scheduled over phone. In person interview was 15 questions with opportunity to ask own personal questions. Very polite staff, however very late to respond to emails and hear back.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position?

title: Program Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions:
Lengthy interview process but this process will help SHSU better understand what kind of individual and employee you could be. 

My interview lasted a couple hours but having that amount helped me because while I felt like early on I struggled with some questions I improved throughout because I had time to become more comfortable.
Interview Questions: What qualities do you have that will help SHSU and specifically our department

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was conducted by 2 ladies who worked there and were department heads. I was mainly asked about my work experience, and how they would tie in with this job. As well as, if I was a fast learner.
Interview Questions: Experiences and if I was a fast learner.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Nov 2020
Interview Descriptions:
Great experience:
1. Screening followed by panel interview in person. Recommendations and then full day interview.  Interview process is fairly easy, feel free to ask questions. Dont be afraid, or intimedated.
Interview Questions: Q. Previous experience and technical skills

title: Admission Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: phone interview and then a follow up zoom interview with fifteen minute presentation. The phone interview was three simple questions. The zoom interview was with multiple people and lasted about 45 minutes to an hour.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: University staff jobs take a while to process. However, the interview process is simple and standard, with typically a face-to-face environment with three to five people. Afterwards, you typically hear back in a short amount of time if you were selected or not.
Interview Questions: How would you organize your tasks?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: You are asked to create plans of action/complete surveys that include possible plans of action to garner student interest in SHSU before you're even interviewed. Then, you get a phone interview, a Skype interview, and last round onboarding interview. If you don't make it to the onboarding interview, you get a line letter. Of all of the interviews I've ever done, this was the most dehumanizing due to the line letter rejection.
Interview Questions: Name a time you overcame a difficult [client]. List three words that describe you, three greatest strengths/weaknesses, etc. The usual questions.

title: Fitness Department Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: After going through their training (personal trainer or group fitness instructor) I had to do a mini group fitness workout with current employees. Afterwards during the questions it was just me and 2 supervisors. They asked questions relating to fitness and behavorial style. The process took a few months since you have to do their training which involves being taught several formats.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a participant was struggling

title: Telecounselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Interview was divided into 2 parts. The first was a phone interview and the second was a group interview. The phone call was straight forward with basic interviewing questions. The group interview was a series of games and assessments of teamwork
Interview Questions: Define leadership from your perspective.

title: Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: Basic panel Interview. 3-4 person hiring board. Mostly technical and personal questions. Nothing too invasive or difficult if you have any basic tech knowledge.  This is in essence a full time student worker position. You won't have many responsibilities by definition, but will be treated as though you do.
Interview Questions: Download the drivers for this printer from the manufacturers website.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Jobs for Kats and then they gave me a call 2 weeks after. We sat down for an interview (4 people) and they were very inviting and had good questions.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a combative person over the phone?

title: Assistant Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX)
Interview Descriptions: This interview occurred at the main Huntsville, Texas campus. Interview was okay. Classism definitely occurs here, between those who have higher degrees than others. Work experience does not count - only your degree does. It is a nice campus with a lot of history - very hilly though. You will definitely get in shape walking up those hills!
Interview Questions: The interview questions were your basic questions. No surprises.

title: Assistant Treasurer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Had to meet with the VP . Answer the typical questions. For Instance , tell me about yourself? Are you comfortable with Microsoft office ? Etc. Then I had to get technical.
Interview Questions: What do you like about accounting the most ?

title: Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Houston, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview included mostly Behaviour questions and intermedite technical questions based on level. Hiring process scheduled in three rounds. phone interview, face to face with group and salary negotiation. whole process was done in and around 1-2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about youself

title: Informal Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Sam Houston, TX) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: About 10 min. With the basic questions. (Strenths, weaknesses, about rec sports, why you want to work for them, etc) Walk in professional, smile, be friendly, shake hands. Oh, and u will have 1-3 people interview you
Interview Questions: What are your strenths and weaknesses?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: At first someone called me to schedule the interview. They had multiple slots open so that was nice. When I went to the interview I just talked to three people in a small office. They told me their names but didn't exactly tell me what they did in the office. They asked me some questions that they said they legally have to ask everyone. It was pretty easy. One of the people in the office never said anything the whole time. That was a little weird. And we were really cramped in that office so it was kind of hot. I never got a call back.
Interview Questions:
Describe how you stay organized.

How long do you plan to stay in this position?

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: You can apply online, usually there are openings every semester. The application process asks for a questionnaire along with the application itself. Rather simple, and not stressful. You are interviewed by three current resident advisors. The whole process takes about 30 minutes. They want to get to know who you are, your values and work ethic.
Interview Questions: The questions were geared towards getting to know the individual, and their ability to adapt to a new environment and new people. Ensuring that one would hold true to the policies set by the University and the department were also emphasized.

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Sam Houston, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied at their website, got a call for an interview in 2 weeks, went to an interview where 3 people were asking me questions such as why I was a good fit, my interests, my way of learning new things, how long I was planning to stay, and other basic questions. At the end they asked me if I had any questions which I replied NO, and regret because now I don't know how long to wait for a phone call to see if I got the job or not. Dress professionally.
Interview Questions: What would your most recent employer say about you and your work habits?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a face to face interview by the department chair and secretary. It was more like a casual conversation where they asked me questions on what I did and told me what they expect from me. Immediately told me that I was selected and gave me the offer. Paperwork took some time, about a week
Interview Questions: What does confidentiality mean to you?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: Three people ask questions pertaining to personality and work ethic. Don't need a lot of work experience but it is a big plus so you can make sure you're in the right department.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Marketing & Promotions Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Sam Houston State in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Found the job posting online and went through two phone interviews. Living far from Huntsville did not allow for me to travel. However, no Skype interview was conducted and it was a rather simple interview process.
Interview Questions: How do you plan to change/improve the organization?

title: IT Technician I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions:
There was a phone interview(technical and non-technical)
You will need to be familiar with both Mac and windows operating systems.
be ready to talk about customer service experiences
you will need to get familiar with all the Sam Houston Web pages
Interview Questions: Printer and classroom troubleshooting

title: Staff Member Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: Initially contacted by the Human Resources Department via phone to schedule an interview. 1-3 members on the hiring committee. Some departments will select from the candidates without a 2nd round of interviews.
Interview Questions: Typical questions, some pertain to the types of technology the individual will be required to use.

title: Admissions Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sam Houston State
Interview Descriptions: I was first e-mailed by Human Resources and then received a call to set up an interview.  About a month and a half after the interview I received an e-mail from Human Resources to complete a background check.  About a week after that I found out that I received the position.
Interview Questions: There weren't any trick questions.  It was more of a conversation about what I expected and what the job would be about.

title: Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: applied and got a call within a week. Interview was real relaxed and consisted of very simple questions aimed at getting to know what kind of person you are. Got a call later that day telling me i go the job
Interview Questions: what is your biggest weakness

title: Student Assistant - Receiving Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very informal process.  Supervisor brought me in his office, we had a one-on-one interview where he asked various questions to ensure I was qualified and physically able to perform the job duties.  He then showed me the warehouse and explained how things were categorized and the ticket pulling process.  He then asked if I had problems lifting large or heavy objects and if I could drive a fork lift.
Interview Questions: Do you have a problem working in the heat?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I sat in the department conference room with the department chair, graduate director, and several professors. I was familiar with most of the people in the interview because I had taken classes from them and they knew I was a good student. My interview was just a casual meeting with these individuals where they explained the details of the job and asked if I would like to become a Graduate Assistant. This wasn't a job I applied for, but was more recruited to by professors I had a good relationship with.
Interview Questions: Have you considered getting a master's degree? If so, by working as a graduate assistant you could pay for your tuition while gaining experience teaching and working in a University setting.

title: Ticket Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sam Houston State (Huntsville, TX) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I called asking for a job, the manager sent me a job application through e-mail, I sign it the document and went in the facility. I turn the document in and gave them my Social Security, waited  and got the job. There was no interview
Interview Questions: N/A
